files.description:
This file contains the disorders (\omega_n and \omega_n') applied in the experiments shown in Figs. 2B, 2C, and 2D of the main text. 

File structure is as follows: Dimensions = {2,20,20} i.e. two lists with 20, 20 element lists. The first set of lists is applied to the inter-cell tunneling links t_n and the second set of lists to the intra-cell tunnelings m_n. The second dimension represents the 'disorder index' or disorder realizations. The experiments shown in Fig. 2D use all 20 disorder realizations. The third dimension represents the 'n' in t_n or m_n, i.e. the actual tunneling link in the lattice which the random number will be applied to.
files.label: disorders_for_fig2.dat

dataFile.description:
This file contains the disorders (\omega_n and \omega_n') applied in the experiments shown in Figs. 2B, 2C, and 2D of the main text. 

File structure is as follows: Dimensions = {2,20,20} i.e. two lists with 20, 20 element lists. The first set of lists is applied to the inter-cell tunneling links t_n and the second set of lists to the intra-cell tunnelings m_n. The second dimension represents the 'disorder index' or disorder realizations. The experiments shown in Fig. 2D use all 20 disorder realizations. The third dimension represents the 'n' in t_n or m_n, i.e. the actual tunneling link in the lattice which the random number will be applied to.

files.description:
This file contains the disorders (\omega_n and \omega_n') applied in the experiments shown in Fig. 3B of the main text. 

File structure is as follows: Dimensions = {2,50,20} i.e. two lists with 50, 20 element lists. The first set of lists is applied to the inter-cell tunneling links t_n and the second set of lists to the intra-cell tunnelings m_n. The second dimension represents the 'disorder index' or disorder realizations. The experiments shown in Fig. 3B use all 50 disorder realizations. The third dimension represents the 'n' in t_n or m_n, i.e. the actual tunneling link in the lattice which the random number will be applied to.
files.label: disorders_for_fig3.dat

dataFile.description:
This file contains the disorders (\omega_n and \omega_n') applied in the experiments shown in Fig. 3B of the main text. 

File structure is as follows: Dimensions = {2,50,20} i.e. two lists with 50, 20 element lists. The first set of lists is applied to the inter-cell tunneling links t_n and the second set of lists to the intra-cell tunnelings m_n. The second dimension represents the 'disorder index' or disorder realizations. The experiments shown in Fig. 3B use all 50 disorder realizations. The third dimension represents the 'n' in t_n or m_n, i.e. the actual tunneling link in the lattice which the random number will be applied to.

files.description: This file contains the set of {W,m} points which make up the critical boundary in Fig. 2A
files.label: Fig2A_Critical_Boundary.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the set of {W,m} points which make up the critical boundary in Fig. 2A

files.description: This file contains the simulated data shown in the phase diagram in Fig. 2A. The first column is the tunneling ratio m, the second column is the disorder strength W, and the third column is the topological index nu.
files.label: Fig2A_nu_vs_m_vs_w.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the simulated data shown in the phase diagram in Fig. 2A. The first column is the tunneling ratio m, the second column is the disorder strength W, and the third column is the topological index nu.

files.description: This file contains the experimental data shown in Fig. 2C for the upper panel (W = 0.5). The first column is the time (in tunneling times), the second column gives the measured mean chiral displacement, and the third column gives the standard deviation of the mean of the measured chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig2C_W0p5_experiment.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the experimental data shown in Fig. 2C for the upper panel (W = 0.5). The first column is the time (in tunneling times), the second column gives the measured mean chiral displacement, and the third column gives the standard deviation of the mean of the measured chiral displacement.

files.description: This file contains the simulation line shown in Fig. 2C for the upper panel (W = 0.5). The first column is the time (in tunneling times) and the second column gives the simulated mean chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig2C_W0p5_simulation.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the simulation line shown in Fig. 2C for the upper panel (W = 0.5). The first column is the time (in tunneling times) and the second column gives the simulated mean chiral displacement.

files.description: This file contains the experimental data shown in Fig. 2C for the lower panel (W = 5.0). The first column is the time (in tunneling times), the second column gives the measured mean chiral displacement, and the third column gives the standard deviation of the mean of the measured chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig2C_W5_experiment.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the experimental data shown in Fig. 2C for the lower panel (W = 5.0). The first column is the time (in tunneling times), the second column gives the measured mean chiral displacement, and the third column gives the standard deviation of the mean of the measured chiral displacement.

files.description: This file contains the simulation data shown in Fig. 2C for the lower panel (W = 5). The first column is the time (in tunneling times), the second column gives the simulated mean chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig2C_W5_simulation.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the simulation data shown in Fig. 2C for the lower panel (W = 5). The first column is the time (in tunneling times), the second column gives the simulated mean chiral displacement.

files.description: This file contains all the chiral displacement versus time data shown in Fig. 2D (as averages and as an inset for W=3) for all W values with 20 disorders each. The structure is as follows. The first element in a given list is the W value. The second element is a list of c versus time for each disorder index. The disorder index (integers 1-20) is given as the first element of that list followed by a list containing 3-tuples which give the time (in microseconds), the measured chiral displacement, and the standard deviation of the mean of that measured value.
files.label: Fig2D_c_vs_time.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains all the chiral displacement versus time data shown in Fig. 2D (as averages and as an inset for W=3) for all W values with 20 disorders each. The structure is as follows. The first element in a given list is the W value. The second element is a list of c versus time for each disorder index. The disorder index (integers 1-20) is given as the first element of that list followed by a list containing 3-tuples which give the time (in microseconds), the measured chiral displacement, and the standard deviation of the mean of that measured value.

files.description: This file contains the simulated mean chiral displacement (using the experimental parameters) curve shown in Fig. 2D (gold solid line). The first column gives the disorder strength W and the second column gives the mean chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig2D_IdealExperimentSimulation.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the simulated mean chiral displacement (using the experimental parameters) curve shown in Fig. 2D (gold solid line). The first column gives the disorder strength W and the second column gives the mean chiral displacement.

files.description: This file contains the large system long time simulated mean chiral displacement curve shown in Fig. 2D (gold dashed line). The first column gives the disorder strength W and the second column gives the mean chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig2D_LongLargeSimulation.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the large system long time simulated mean chiral displacement curve shown in Fig. 2D (gold dashed line). The first column gives the disorder strength W and the second column gives the mean chiral displacement.

files.description: This file contains the set of {W,m} points which make up the critical boundary in Fig. 3A
files.label: Fig3A_Critical_Boundary.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the set of {W,m} points which make up the critical boundary in Fig. 3A

files.description: This file contains the simulated phase diagram shown in Fig. 3A. The first column contains the tunneling imbalance m, the second column has the disorder strength W, and the third column has the computed topological index nu.
files.label: Fig3A_nu_vs_m_vs_w.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the simulated phase diagram shown in Fig. 3A. The first column contains the tunneling imbalance m, the second column has the disorder strength W, and the third column has the computed topological index nu.

files.description: This file contains all the chiral displacement versus time data shown in Fig. 3B (as averages and as an inset for W=2.5 and 6) for all W values with 50 disorders each. The structure is as follows. The first element in a given list is the W value. The second element is a list of c versus time for each disorder index. The disorder index (integers 1-50) is given as the first element of that list followed by a list containing 3-tuples which give the time (in microseconds), the measured chiral displacement, and the standard deviation of the mean of that measured value.
files.label: Fig3B_c_vs_time.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains all the chiral displacement versus time data shown in Fig. 3B (as averages and as an inset for W=2.5 and 6) for all W values with 50 disorders each. The structure is as follows. The first element in a given list is the W value. The second element is a list of c versus time for each disorder index. The disorder index (integers 1-50) is given as the first element of that list followed by a list containing 3-tuples which give the time (in microseconds), the measured chiral displacement, and the standard deviation of the mean of that measured value.

files.description: This file contains the simulation (using the experimental parameters) shown in Fig. 3B (solid gold line). The first column contains the disorder strength W and the second column contains the mean chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig3B_IdealExperimentSimulation.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the simulation (using the experimental parameters) shown in Fig. 3B (solid gold line). The first column contains the disorder strength W and the second column contains the mean chiral displacement.

files.description: This file contains the long time large system simulation shown in Fig. 3B (dashed gold line). The first column contains the disorder strength W and the second column contains the mean chiral displacement.
files.label: Fig3B_LongLargeSimulation.dat

dataFile.description: This file contains the long time large system simulation shown in Fig. 3B (dashed gold line). The first column contains the disorder strength W and the second column contains the mean chiral displacement.
